void setSwitchTypeface (const gaia::graphics::Typeface *tf)

Detailed Description

A Switch is a two-state toggle switch widget that can select between two options.

The user may drag the "thumb" back and forth to choose the selected option, or simply tap to toggle as if it were a checkbox. The text property controls the text displayed in the label for the switch, whereas the off and on text controls the text on the thumb.

The following example demonstrates how to use the Switch

      Scene* scene = Scene::SceneFactory(this);
      LinearController* linearController = new LinearController(this);

      // Create a Switch instance.
      Switch* mSwitch = new Switch(this);

      linearController->addWidget(mSwitch);
      scene->attachController(linearController);
      scene->setupSceneLayout();

void gaia::ui::Switch::setSwitchTypeface ( const gaia::graphics::Typeface *  tf)

Sets the typeface in which the text should be displayed on the switch.

Note that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use setSwitchTypeface(Typeface, int) to get the appearance that you actually want.

Parameters:
tftypeface
void gaia::ui::Switch::setSwitchTypeface ( const gaia::graphics::Typeface *  tf,
int32_t  style 
)

Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed on the switch, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.
